Legal_Issue: Whether the IRB's decision denying refugee status was reasonable and based on credible evidence
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (sections 96 and 97)
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution due to family targeting and political activity
Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; IRBâ€™s decision upheld
Court_Ruling: IRB's decision was reasonable and supported by evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution due to family targeting and political activity
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Federal Courts Rules
Credibility_Assessment: IRB found the applicant not credible
Evidence_Used: Evidence considered by IRB in original decision
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution based on family and political grounds
Evidence_Assessed: Original evidence before IRB; fresh evidence not admitted
Relief_Sought: Overturning of IRB's negative refugee determination
Governing_Rule: Federal Courts Rules regarding admissible evidence in judicial reviews
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Fresh evidence submitted after IRB decision
Cause_Description: Applicant sought judicial review after being denied refugee status by the IRB
Evidence_Issues: Timing and admissibility of new evidence
Legal_Provision: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Assessment limited to record before IRB
Decision_Rationale: IRB's credibility findings were reasonable and based on evidence
Decision_Making_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court (reviewing body)
Evidentiary_Issues: Fresh evidence not part of original record
